member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.AddIOTEResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Adds to or modifies the tags of the given resource. Tags are metadata that can be used to manage a resource.

para.para: The ARN of the resource.
The new or modified tags for the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.AddIOTEResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.AddIOTEResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.AddIOTEResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEAlarmModelCmdlet
member.summary: Retrieves information about an alarm model. If you don't specify a value for the alarmModelVersion parameter, the latest version is returned.

para.para: The name of the alarm model.
The version of the alarm model.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEAlarmModelCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.DescribeAlarmModelResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.DescribeAlarmModelResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEAlarmModelCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the AlarmModelName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^AlarmModelName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEAlarmModelListCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists the alarm models that you created. The operation returns only the metadata associated with each alarm model.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.
The token that you can use to return the next set of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEAlarmModelListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'AlarmModelSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.ListAlarmModelsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.ListAlarmModelsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEAlarmModelListCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEAlarmModelVersionListCmdlet

Lists all the versions of an alarm model. The operation returns only the metadata associated with each alarm model version.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

The token that you can use to return the next set of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEDetectorModelAnalysisCmdlet
member.summary:
Retrieves runtime information about a detector model analysis.
After AWS IoT Events starts analyzing your detector model, you have up to 24 hours to retrieve the analysis results.

para.para: The ID of the analysis result that you want to retrieve.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEDetectorModelAnalysisCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Status'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.DescribeDetectorModelAnalysisResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.DescribeDetectorModelAnalysisResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the AnalysisId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^AnalysisId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEDetectorModelAnalysisResultCmdlet
member.summary:
Retrieves one or more analysis results of the detector model.
After AWS IoT Events starts analyzing your detector model, you have up to 24 hours to retrieve the analysis results.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The ID of the analysis result that you want to retrieve.
The maximum number of results to be returned per request.
The token that you can use to return the next set of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.GetIOTEDetectorModelListCmdlet
member.summary:
Lists the detector models you have created. Only the metadata associated with each detector model is returned.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The maximum number of results to be returned per request.

summary.para:
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.

para.para: The token that you can use to return the next set of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.NewIOTEAlarmModelCmdlet
member.summary: Creates an alarm model to monitor an AWS IoT Events input attribute. You can use the alarm to get notified when the value is outside a specified range. For more information, see Create an alarm model in the AWS IoT Events Developer Guide.

para.para: Specifies one or more supported actions to receive notifications when the alarm state changes.
A description that tells you what the alarm model detects.
A unique name that helps you identify the alarm model. You can't change this name after you create the alarm model.
The comparison operator.
The value must be TRUE or FALSE. If FALSE, all alarm instances created based on the alarm model are activated. The default value is TRUE.

The value must be TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, you receive a notification when the alarm state changes. You must choose to acknowledge the notification before the alarm state can return to NORMAL. If FALSE, you won't receive notifications. The alarm automatically changes to the NORMAL state when the input property value returns to the specified range.
The value on the left side of the comparison operator. You can specify an AWS IoT Events input attribute as an input property.
An input attribute used as a key to create an alarm. AWS IoT Events routes inputs associated with this key to the alarm.
Contains the notification settings of an alarm model. The settings apply to all alarms that were created based on this alarm model.
The ARN of the IAM role that allows the alarm to perform actions and access AWS resources. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.
A non-negative integer that reflects the severity level of the alarm.

A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the alarm model. The tags help you manage the alarm model. For more information, see Tagging your AWS IoT Events resources in the AWS IoT Events Developer Guide.
You can create up to 50 tags for one alarm model.
The value on the right side of the comparison operator. You can enter a number or specify an AWS IoT Events input attribute.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.NewIOTEAlarmModelCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.CreateAlarmModelResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.CreateAlarmModelResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.NewIOTEAlarmModelCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.NewIOTEDetectorModelCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a detector model.

para.para: A brief description of the detector model.
The name of the detector model.
Information about the order in which events are evaluated and how actions are executed.
The state that is entered at the creation of each detector (instance).

The input attribute key used to identify a device or system to create a detector (an instance of the detector model) and then to route each input received to the appropriate detector (instance). This parameter uses a JSON-path expression in the message payload of each input to specify the attribute-value pair that is used to identify the device associated with the input.
The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT Events to perform its operations.
Information about the states of the detector.
Metadata that can be used to manage the detector model.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.NewIOTEDetectorModelCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DetectorModelConfiguration'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.CreateDetectorModelResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.CreateDetectorModelResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DetectorModelName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DetectorModelName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.NewIOTEInputCmdlet
member.summary: Creates an input.

para.para: The attributes from the JSON payload that are made available by the input. Inputs are derived from messages sent to the AWS IoT Events system using BatchPutMessage. Each such message contains a JSON payload, and those attributes (and their paired values) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors that monitor this input.
A brief description of the input.
The name you want to give to the input.
Metadata that can be used to manage the input.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.NewIOTEInputCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'InputConfiguration'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.CreateInputResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.CreateInputResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.RemoveIOTEInputCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.DeleteInputResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.RemoveIOTEInputCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the InputName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^InputName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.RemoveIOTEInputCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

para.para: The state that is entered at the creation of each detector (instance).
Information about the states of the detector.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.UpdateIOTEAlarmModelCmdlet
member.summary: Updates an alarm model. Any alarms that were created based on the previous version are deleted and then created again as new data arrives.

para.para: Specifies one or more supported actions to receive notifications when the alarm state changes.
The description of the alarm model.
The name of the alarm model.
The comparison operator.
The value must be TRUE or FALSE. If FALSE, all alarm instances created based on the alarm model are activated. The default value is TRUE.

The value must be TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, you receive a notification when the alarm state changes. You must choose to acknowledge the notification before the alarm state can return to NORMAL. If FALSE, you won't receive notifications. The alarm automatically changes to the NORMAL state when the input property value returns to the specified range.
The value on the left side of the comparison operator. You can specify an AWS IoT Events input attribute as an input property.
Contains the notification settings of an alarm model. The settings apply to all alarms that were created based on this alarm model.
The ARN of the IAM role that allows the alarm to perform actions and access AWS resources. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.
A non-negative integer that reflects the severity level of the alarm.
The value on the right side of the comparison operator. You can enter a number or specify an AWS IoT Events input attribute.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.UpdateIOTEAlarmModelCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.UpdateAlarmModelResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.UpdateAlarmModelResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Updates a detector model. Detectors (instances) spawned by the previous version are deleted and then re-created as new inputs arrive.

para.para: A brief description of the detector model.
The name of the detector model that is updated.
Information about the order in which events are evaluated and how actions are executed.
The state that is entered at the creation of each detector (instance).
The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT Events to perform its operations.
Information about the states of the detector.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.UpdateIOTEInputCmdlet
member.summary: Updates an input.

para.para: The attributes from the JSON payload that are made available by the input. Inputs are derived from messages sent to the AWS IoT Events system using BatchPutMessage. Each such message contains a JSON payload, and those attributes (and their paired values) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors that monitor this input.
A brief description of the input.
The name of the input you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.UpdateIOTEInputCmdlet.Select

Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.UpdateInputResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.WriteIOTELoggingOptionCmdlet
member.summary:
Sets or updates the AWS IoT Events logging options.
If you update the value of any loggingOptions field, it takes up to one minute for the change to take effect. If you change the policy attached to the role you specified in the roleArn field (for example, to correct an invalid policy), it takes up to five minutes for that change to take effect.

para.para: Information that identifies those detector models and their detectors (instances) for which the logging level is given.
If TRUE, logging is enabled for AWS IoT Events.
The logging level.
The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT Events to perform logging.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IOTE.WriteIOTELoggingOptionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEvents.Model.PutLoggingOptionsResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
